decision_reasoning: system for exercising discretion under s. 114(2)
decisions of immigration officers properly made
evidence_assessment: Vidal's case lacked sufficient hardship evidence
Dadwah's case was improperly dismissed as not meeting guidelines
discretion_exercise: Guidelines allow flexibility but emphasize consistency
Economic factors alone are insufficient, and family ties require specific hardship
conclusion_outcome: Dadwah's application is granted due to improper reliance on guidelines without considering unique hardships
cause_of_action: Applicants challenged immigration officers' decisions under s. 114(2)
alleging improper discretion and systemic flaws
procedure_followed: Judicial review analyzed whether guidelines and officer decisions complied with statutory discretion requirements
